paper_abstract: Continuous common mode feedback (CMFB) circuits having high input impedance and low distortion are proposed. The proposed circuits are characterized for 0.18 mu m CMOS process with 1.8 V supply. Simulation results indicate that the proposed common mode detector consumes no standby power and CMFB circuit consumes 27-34% less power than previous high swing CMFB circuits.
paper_title: LOW POWER CONTINUOUS TIME COMMON MODE SENSING FOR COMMON MODE FEEDBACK CIRCUITS
